Review Text: Took awhile to get checked in. The Porter took us up to a room that sank of cigarette smoke and weed. They had sprayed profuse amounts of air freshener in an attempt to mask the smell. It didn't work and both smells would either make you nauseous or give one a headache. I asked for another room...i wasn't happy when there wasn't one in my range available (admittedly it was vals weekend) as they tried to arm twist me to paying for an upgrade. I refused and asked for a refund. The pleasant manager calmed me down and asked me to hold on. I went to have a pleasant meal in their restaurant. Luckily they made up another room for us. It didn't smell as bad. But in a rush...they forgot our bottled water and extra towel.  Twas a nuisance. Later we went to the pool for drinks...i was

The hotel is nice and very spacious. Had my 25th wedding anniversary there. Good service and good attention to general hygiene given the current covid pandemic. They really made us feel welcome. They decorated our room with rose petals at no extra cost at my request.  The Salma restaurant is a good place to eat.

Good Location  Good Hospitality , you feel welcomed by the staff Two very good restaurants in the compound. access to the lagoon canal enables maritime traffic almost to everywhere. nice pool . rooms are large

Good amenities in the room. I found the cable tv and movie selection to be exceptional. Complaints were attended to promptly and very courteously. The location is superb. Overall a nice time. Will go back!

The service was top notch...friendly staff and rooms are clean. Breakfast has limited options. I paid for a suite and find there was no TV in the room annoying as the kids took the only TV in the sitting room, spent my days looking up the ceiling.   Safe was broken down and towels are worn out. I ll hesitate going back.

Treated my husband to a birthday weekend stay at Maroko. Hands down best service received since i've been visiting Nigeria. The view is amazing and it was an overall relaxing weekend. We will definitely return.

Clean hotel, with spacious rooms. Good service by staff. Location is good if you have to use boat transport, has a jetty next door. Good pool side restaurant. Breakfast is continental and Nigerian local food.  Restaurant is Lebanese , with good choice
Room Tips: Choose rooms facing the water side is better

Review Text: I proposed to my wife at the pool side with nice ocean view. They have a very good customer service and food.  Well spacious room with basic amenities.  Really enjoyed my trip here. I will visit again and again

We found the apartments clean and well maintained. The staff were incredibly polite and helpful, and would do their best to accommodate our requests. I believe an iron and an ironing board in the rooms, will complete the experience. Parking could be a challenge because of the limited ground space. The breakfast buffet was enjoyable and more than adequate. Overall we had a good time and this could become of my favorite places.
Room Tips: Rooms facing the bay have better views and rooms on the higher floors are quieter

Review Text: The General Manager here is just excellent and his staff and crew follow up to the standards he sets. It's a great place with a gym next door and you have mall close by too. There is also banks and a  club near by not to mention the resturant 100 meters next door. It's a great location
Review Text

facilities that was not included in the room was electric kettle and clothing iron. We had to request for a clothing iron everyday from the front desk and was given limited time to use it because other guests staying at the property needed to use it. Please note they only have 2 Irons available for all guests staying in the property to use.   The breakfast did not exceed my expectations and it was very bland. I will like to suggest they should label the food for breakfast on the trays. guests with allergies will be aware of what the ingredient entails. On one occasion i thought i was eating puff puff but the taste made me realize i was eating akara which would have been prevented if it was labelled.   The staff service was friendly and attentive.   I have included a picture of

Good place to relax when not working  Nice pool, good service, view of the lagoon  Reasonable price, close to shops,  Comfortable beds, gym close by. Highly recomended for business travelers who need to rest

this is my favorite places for a staycation, the service is top notch, staff are attentive, breakfast is superb and what i absolutely love is the beds, very comfortable. i always sleep like a baby. it has also been newly renovated, with a restaurant on site.

Travel frequently to Lagos on duty and stay longer periods 3-4 weeks. Found this hotel by chance walking in to look at the rooms as I didnâ€™t like many other hotels with big names))). GM Mr Bernard was very friendly to show me around and I decided to stay at the hotel. From the very beginning staff made my stay most enjoyable. Resolved all issues fast and to my satisfaction. All staff is very friendly. Hotel provides airport transfer which is safe. On hotel compound there is a guy with good equipment  and a cosy restaurant Cactus. The swimming pool is absolutely worth spending your time.  To top all that location of the hotel is unbeatable with good security.  As for rooms they are very spacious and just the perfect match for longer stays. One really feels like at home.

my husband and I have been staying at this property since April (me on and off). We have a suite, which consists of 2 rooms. There is a small kitchen (only a microwave and a small frig, sink and cabinet space) which I am able to prepare snacks and some meals (with the help of my crockpot). The room is a little "dated" could use a remodel. The hotel is in the process of remodeling the pool area, lobby and restaurant. There is a "gym" (proflex) which is 2 doors down from the hotel property. There is also a separate restaurant called "Cactus" which is popular with the expats and locals. They serve breakfast, lunch, dinner, beer and wine. The hotel property is secure in it's own compound. The generator goes on and off more than I would care for, but this is Lagos! They offer laundry

Although not very well known, this hotel is just beautiful. The suites are so large and clean, you'd surely want to forget the big names. The price, location and great view of the Atlantic makes this the place to relax in the heart of the business centre of Lagos. Forget the big names and give this place a try. It's currently undergoing a renovation of the ground floors and the pool which may lead to some noise occasionally but the value here is great.

Very confortable , good location , clean , affordable and the best hospitality,,,the room are very big ,the bed is huge ,small kitchen is available in all type of rooms ,the view of the lagoon is majestic morning and night , will definitely suggested cheers

A perfect location for love birds. I and my husband had a nice time at Maroko bay suites.Good customer service, hospitable, Neat,tranquil and lovely environment. Yes good food, nice presentation. lovely spacious rooms with Serene environment.

This hotel boasts of very clean, well lit up and modern rooms. Very spacious i must add. I enjoyed each night because the bed and the pillows made for a great night's rest. The pillows were very comfortable to say the least! You would think that being in VI would make it a noisy place but the serenity of the environment is quite commendable. The front desk staff were very helpful and warm. The swimming pool was so clean that it made swimming fun!

Review Title: Maroko Bayshore Suites have huge suites at great prices.
Review Text: I needed to stay in Lagos for 10 days and wanted to have a large room without paying the usual 5 star prices. I was recommended this place.   It is very comfortable, not glitzy but functional. Staff are very warm, polite and helpful. The daily laundry service and breakfast is an added bonus  The view from the Executive Suites is amazing.  The place is well managed and well run
